section: Client acknowledges and agrees that all due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are guaranteed by the Company, regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client. Delays will not affect the due dates.
explanation: This creates an impossible situation where the company guarantees due dates 'regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client'. Delays will not affect the due dates. If the client does not provide the materials on time, it is impossible for the company to meet a deadline, making the guarantee a contradiction.

section: Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work. However, the Client can pay the remaining amount at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion.
explanation: The original clause clearly states that the remaining $3,100 is due 'on completion of the Scope of Work.' The new sentence allows the client to pay the amount at any time before completion, creating an ambiguity as to when the final payment is due, giving two different options. Does that mean that they have to pay it at completion, or at anytime before?

section: Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service throughout the duration of this agreement, and may not alter or cease providing Customer Service. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: Here, the section clearly states that the Company has to continue customer service and may not alter the services. However, the section then proceeds to give the company the option of altering the customer service that it provides, making this very ambiguous.
